intro: Silene corylina, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features striking red or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a white or pale pink center. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and often branched. Silene corylina is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, where it thrives in full sun.
